cramp.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body
cramp.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Several players were suffering from cramp.
One of the swimmers got cramp and had to drop out of the race.
cramp.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to prevent the development of someone or something
cramp.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Stricter anti-pollution laws may cramp economic growth.
cramp.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to get or cause cramp in a muscle
cramp.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He cramped in the last 200 metres of the race.
Sitting still for so long had cramped her muscles.
